oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Do carrots really have to travel 700 kilometres?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kakriainen, Salla
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Markets and trade
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The transport question was a starting point for local food activities in Kauhajoki, in western Finland. Questioning this led to further activities in the area. In the Suupohja region there has been a whole series of projects to develop ordering systems, marketing, etc. All have had a common goal of promoting the use of local food.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kakriainen, Salla (2005) Do carrots really have to travel 700 kilometres? In: Kakriainen, Salla and von Essen, Hans (Eds.) Obstacles and solutions in use of local and organic food. Ekologiskt lantbruk, no. 44. Sveriges lantbruksuniversitet, Centrum för uthålligt lantbruk, pp. 61-64.
